title: Voting begins in 264 Municipal Councils and Nagar Panchayats in Maharashtra
content: Nearly one crore voters are eligible to exercise their franchise in the first round of the multi-tier rural and urban local bodies elections

title: Winter Session of M.P. Assembly begins with protests over cough syrup tragedy, short duration of session
content: The four-day-long session began with members paying their condolences to various people, including film actor and former Lok Sabha MP Dharmendra, former Union Minister Shriprakash Jaiswal, and the victims of the explosion near Delhi’s Red Fort

title: BJP demands audit of 1.25 crore entries made in SIR across three days in West Bengal
content: Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari claimed that between 26-28 November, digitisation figures of enumeration forms jumped from 5.5 crore to 6.75 crore, an abnormal and statistically impossible jump of 1.25 crore entries within just three days.

title: Indian armed forces to procure more satellite-linked Heron Mk II UAVs under emergency procurement
content: Army and Air Force, which already operate Heron Mk II drones, have placed additional orders while the Indian Navy is acquiring them for the first time, says official

title: Plea in Indore court seeks FIR against IAS Santosh Verma over controversial remarks
content: Shailendra Dwivedi, an Indore-based lawyer, filed a plea before the Judicial Magistrate First Class seeking directions for the police to register an FIR against IAS Santosh Verma while alleging that his statement was “vulgar, obscene and cheap”

title: Abhishek refutes allegations of contesting 2026 Assembly polls from Nandigram
content: Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari once again challenged the Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee to contest from Bhabanipur

title: New HIV cases highest in Mizoram; fresh infections drop nationally by 48% from 2010-2024: report
content: Annual AIDS-related mortality rate per 1,00,000 population estimated nationally at 2.32, with Manipur topping the list, says the India HIV estimate 2025 technical report

title: Delhi blast probe: NIA searches nine locations in Jammu and Kashmir, Uttar Pradesh
content: The NIA said that “various digital devices and other incriminating materials were seized” from the “premises of several accused and suspects in the two States”

title: Finally Lottulodukku and Gulgulmaal win something, albeit on a cricket turf
content: Over 50 regular local cricketers, split into eight teams, decided to get creative with team names for the seventh edition of their locally held tournament at a turf in Kochi

title: Can Paravur break with the past by ending political deadlock?
content: Amid intense competition between LDF and UDF for control of the 32-ward municipality, the NDA aims at gaining ground and influencing the formation of the ruling council in case of a tie.

title: Modi promises ‘all possible support’ for ailing Khaleda Zia
content: A five-member delegation of Chinese doctors has reached Bangladesh to assist the team supervising the former Prime Minister’s treatment at a hospital in Dhaka

title: Women candidates should prioritise provision of clean public toilets this campaign season, says public health expert
content: This is a basic health requirement which finds little or no mention in the election manifestos of even major political parties, says former Kerala University V-C B. Ekbal

title: Kuki-Zo Council objects to ‘renewed attempts’ to implement law taking away tribal chiefs’ land rights
content: “The very notion that a non-tribal organisation is proposing fundamental changes to tribal land governance highlights deep disregard for tribal rights,” says Kuki-Zo Council

title: HC directs robust sea wall along Edavanakkad coast
content: This followed a plea by residents of the area who pointed out that the panchayat has a coastal shore of approximately 2.4 kms, which is vulnerable to sea and soil erosion

title: PM Modi calls Sri Lankan President to offer continued support with cyclone relief
content: As part of Operation Sagar Bandhu, nationals of Sri Lanka, India, Germany, Slovenia, United Kingdom, South Africa, Poland, Belarus, Iran, Australia, Pakistan and Bangladesh have been rescued

title: Tirupparankundram temple management can light lamp at Deepathoon: High Court
content: Justice G.R. Swaminathan says Deepathoon is located at a lower peak at a distance of not less than 50 metres from the mosque. It is in the unoccupied portion and belongs exclusively to the temple

title: SIR 2.0: Election Commission dismisses allegations of ‘mass disenfranchisement’
content: The poll body tells Supreme Court that 95.65% of electors in Tamil Nadu and 99.77% in West Bengal have already been supplied with pre-filled enumeration forms

title: Number of government schools falls, but those with fewer than 10 students see a steady rise
content: Data tabled in Parliament reveals that the number of teachers employed at such schools rose from 1.26 lakh in 2022-23 to 1.44 lakh in 2024-25

title: Nine major bank fraud accused among 15 fugitive economic offenders: govt.
content: Since June 2014, 120 people have been convicted under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, Ministry tells Lok Sabha

title: Role of Coimbatore gang-rape accused suspected in herder’s murder
content: The body of the victim, M. Devaraj, 55, of Kurumbapalayam near Muthugoundenpudur, was found with blunt injuries at Serayampalayam on November 6

title: Chennai and its neighbouring districts may get heavy rain on December 2
content: The Regional Meteorological Centre says the deep depression, a remnant of Cyclone Ditwah, is likely to move northwards parallel to the north Tamil Nadu and south A.P. coasts over the next six hours

title: Priyanka slams Modi, says raising issues of people is not ‘drama’
content: “The Prime Minister says, ‘enjoy the weather’. What weather should the people of Delhi enjoy? At least take a peek outside to see what is happening in the country,” Ms. Vadra said.

title: On the first day of Winter Session, Opposition walks out over SIR
content: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said all Opposition floor leaders had met at his chamber and decided to raise the issue of Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in one voice

title: CBI officer assesses progress of probe into Karur stampede
content: CBI Deputy Inspector-General of Police Atul Kumar Thakur visits  the scene of stampede and studies the area. He also holds spot consultations with CBI officials camping in Karur for carrying out the investigation

title: Senior BJP leader Prem Kumar all set to become Speaker of Bihar Assembly
content: He is expected to get elected unopposed since no other candidate has filed nomination papers for the post

title: Third edition of BLR Hubba to begin on January 16
content: Aiming to position Bengaluru on the global cultural map, the 10-day event will feature over 250 performances across more than 12 genres, including international acts from Japan and Malaysia and a special appearance by guitar legend Marty Friedman

title: Radhakrishnan urged to be impartial as he chairs first Rajya Sabha session
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi hails Vice-President’s rise from humble origins as a testament to Indian democracy; Mallikarjun Kharge’s reference to Jagdeep Dhankhar’s sudden exit sparks furore

title: Renewable, low-carbon systems to fuel TG clean-energy powerhouse vision
content: Hyderabad will have largest electric bus fleet by 2030, internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles will not be sold after 2039

title: Bengaluru Central Corporation targets major commercial establishments for tax evasion
content: While the current drive focuses only on commercial establishments, the corporation may take up residential property verification in the future

title: ‘Congress govt. planning ₹82,000 crore burden on people with new thermal power projects’
content: BRS leader Harish Rao questions the rationale in going for new plants when NTPC is offering energy at a competitive price from Telangana-dedicated project

title: Suraj Lama case: Kerala HC seeks details from hospital
content: HC also directs the Superintendent of the Government Medical College, Kalamassery, where he was reportedly admitted, to submit reports on his medical history

title: Ministers brave rain to distribute NTR Bharosa pensions in South Coastal A.P.
content: Pensions worth ₹34,000 crore are being provided to 68 lakh people across the State and 90% of pensions are distributed in a single day, says MA&UD Minister

title: New HIV infections going up steadily in 15-24 year group in Kerala
content: 62.6% of the  individuals who contracted HIV in the past three years in Kerala got the infection through unsafe heterosexual sex involving multiple partners

title: Delhi HC slams Centre for failing to hold Cantonment Boards’ elections
content: “Special notifications could only be issued on special occasions, such as a military operation, and the government’s act might be seen as misuse of its powers,” says Delhi High Court Bench

title: Indian Army successfully conducts combat launch of BrahMos supersonic cruise missile
content: The missile demonstrated high-speed flight stability and terminal precision, striking its designated target accurately

title: OSR lands cannot be converted into housing plots by giving retrospective effect to new rules: Madras High Court
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and Mohammed Shaffiq hold that any reduction in OSR requirements could be made applicable only prospectively

title: LPS 2: Amaravati farmers expect better package, time-bound fulfilment of promises
content: They justify their demands claiming that their land commands a higher value and citing the delay in the development of returnable plots acquired under LPS 1, and slow progress of capital works

title: Lok Sabha passes Manipur GST Bill amid disruptions over SIR
content: The Bill replaces an Ordinance which implemented reforms in Goods and Services Tax in Manipur; statutory resolution moved by Revolutionary Socialist Party member N.K. Premachandran disapproving the Bill was rejected by a voice vote

title: Rahul Easwar remanded; police seize laptop
content: Thiruvananthapuram Cyber Police book him under various Sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, along with provisions of the Information Technology Act

title: Steps to ensure pedestrian safety on zebra crossing
content: MVD officers have been instructed to cancel driving licences of drivers who violate pedestrian safety at zebra crossings

title: Centre defends exemptions for strategic, atomic mineral mining
content: “The exemption will not compromise environmental, social, health, and livelihood concerns.” says Union Minister of State for Environment, Kirti Vardhan Singh

title: A normal winter on the cards for Kerala in December
content: Minimum temperature has dropped below the 20° Celsius mark in many places in the State in the past few days, which is 3 to 4° C lower than the normal during the season

title: Number of village panchayats in the Nilgiris district increases from 35 to 88
content: The new village panchayats have been formed by splitting 27 existing village panchayats. The government has taken the decision, given the factors such as the hilly terrain, the lack of transport, and residents of the villages being unable to reach panchayat union offices

title: NTR Bharosa pensions extended to over 65 lakh beneficiaries, says Minister
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar participates in the pension distribution drive at Yeleswarapalem in Bapatla district, and reviews the delivery of government services

title: Regional language education offered in 16% of KVs: government data
content: Across the country, 226 KVs offer regional language education in 10 languages; 665 of the sanctioned Navodaya Vidyalayas teach at least one of the 18 regional languages

title: Parts of India may get more cold wave days this year, says IMD
content: When the minimum temperature of a station is 10°C or less in the plains and 0°C or less in hilly regions, it is considered a ‘cold wave’ day

title: Andhra Pradesh to roll out film tourism policy; eyes world-class studios and 20% industry share
content: Minister Kandula Durgesh announces stamp duty reimbursement, SGST waivers for 15 years, and capital subsidies up to 25% to boost Telugu cinema and tourism infrastructure across seven anchor hubs

title: Sources: BYU coach Sitake focus of PSU search
content: The Penn State coaching search, which has gone quiet in the past few weeks, has focused on BYU coach Kalani Sitake, sources told ESPN on Monday, confirming a report by On3.

title: Sources: D. Williams lands 3-year deal from Mets
content: After the 31-year-old veteran pitched for the Yankees last season, free-agent reliever Devin Williams and the New York Mets agreed on a three-year contract that guarantees more than $50 million, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan Monday, confirming a report.

title: Kiffin ready to make LSU nation's 'best program'
content: A day after flying out of Oxford, Mississippi, Lane Kiffin was introduced as LSU coach Monday, promising to restore the Tigers to being "the best program in all of college football," while detailing his excruciating decision to leave Ole Miss.

title: Sources: Kentucky targeting Oregon OC Stein
content: Oregon offensive coordinator Will Stein is Kentucky's target to be their next head coach and the sides are working toward a deal, sources told ESPN.

title: Michigan State hires Fitzgerald, touts 'new era'
content: Former Northwestern coach Pat Fitzgerald was hired Monday as the new football coach at Michigan State. Sources told ESPN that it's a five-year deal.

title: Sources: WNBA offering max salary base of $1M
content: The WNBA's latest proposal to the players' union includes a maximum salary base of $1 million, sources told ESPN's Alexa Philippou. The new offer reflects incremental increases from the league's previous proposal.

title: Eagles OC's house gets egged after loss to Bears
content: The New Jersey home of Eagles offensive coordinator Kevin Patullo was vandalized with eggs early Saturday morning, following the team's loss to the Bears, police said.

title: Miami AD: ACC should revisit tiebreaker system
content: A four-game winning streak might not be enough for 10-2 Miami to make the College Football Playoff, and Hurricanes athletic director Dan Radakovich told ESPN the ACC should revisit its tiebreaker system to ensure the league "puts its best foot forward."

title: Wetzel: Lane Kiffin left an actual playoff team for a theoretical one. He should be honest about why
content: Lane Kiffin might be a great coach, but he isn't being treated unfairly by Ole Miss or "the calendar" or anything else.

title: Four intriguing divisions, 10 teams and playoffs on the line: Barnwell makes sense of close races
content: It feels like every division is still up for grabs this season. Let's take a closer look at particularly tight races in the NFC West, NFC South, AFC South and AFC North.

title: 'When do we get our Siakam?': What to make of the Bulls' uneven early season
content: From a 6-1 start to a 9-10 record to begin December, which Chicago Bulls team is the real version and what could be next?

title: The NHL's best this week: Kyle Palmieri, 'hockey guy'
content: The Islanders forward tore his ACL -- then made a brilliant pass to set up a goal. Plus, what to watch this week.

title: Can Ohio State be beaten? Can Texas make the playoff? Can any team win the ACC?
content: Why the Buckeyes are so dominant, the ACC is so confusing and the playoff picture still isn't settled.

title: How a bald coach solved volleyball's ponytail predicament
content: The NCAA volleyball tournament will feature dozens of stars wearing a hair-tie solution invented by none other than three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: Wolverines on the rise
content: The fourth in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Feast Week lessons: Michigan No. 1? St. John's, Florida in trouble?
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to a top-25 showdown in New York, here's what we learned last week.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: UConn still the team to beat
content: The fourth in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Feast Week takeaways: Crooks' 47 points push Iowa State to 9-0
content: Big performances from Texas, LSU and Iowa State headline the most significant results from Feast Week.

title: Welcome to NFL draft season: 30 questions on the QBs, standout prospects and risers to watch
content: Who's in the hunt to go No. 1? How does the QB class look? Which teams need defense? And who could rise at the combine? Let's answer big questions on this class.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Can T.J. Parker climb back up the board?
content: We have draft notes, including what to make of T.J. Parker's three-sack game and Trevor Goosby's rise.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: Free agents: Kyle Monangai, Bam Knight are essential pickups
content: All the free agent options worth adding as we look ahead to Week 14 and the start of the fantasy football playoff season.

title: Buzz: Justin Herbert set for surgery, but aims to play in Week 14
content: Herbert set for surgery, Meyers keeps producing for the Jaguars and Irving looked good in his return in Week 14

title: Chelsea, Arsenal put on a show of title hopefuls, Xabi Alonso's Madrid mess, more
content: Sunday's clash between Premier League title chasers lived up to expectations with drama, controversy and grit. PLUS: Xabi Alonso's tactics lead to Madrid losing more points, as Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: How do Barça contain Atlético's Jack Reacher-like striker?
content: Alexander Sørloth can haunt Barça again and send Atlético top of LaLiga when the sides meet on Tuesday.

title: Allende outshines Messi as Miami book spot vs. Vancouver
content: Tadeo Allende's performance of a lifetime, and the own goal that broke San Diego hearts. Cesar Hernandez and Joseph Lowery to sum up the best and worst of MLS' conference finals as Inter Miami book a date with Vancouver.

title: Athletes Unlimited Softball League: Expansion and allocation draft
content: Who went No. 1 overall? Where did Maya Brady end up? All you need to know about the first AUSL player draft.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: McLaren's Qatar blunder has it on the brink of a 2007 rerun
content: In 2007, McLaren refused to favor either of its drivers, costing the team a title. After another botched call in Qatar, is history repeating itself?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Nusa move
content: Barcelona will look to sign RB Leipzig and Norway winger Antonio Nusa. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Disha Patani's Sister Helps Accident Victims, Flags Ambulance Delay In Video
content: Bollywood actor Disha Patani's sister, Khushboo Patani, has raised pointed questions about emergency response failures after she stopped to help victims of a fatal road accident on the Delhi-Lucknow Highway.

title: Why IPS Officers Holding IAS Posts? High Court Asks Telangana To Explain
content: The Telangana High Court has issued notices to the state government, seeking an explanation regarding the appointment of Indian Police Service officers to several key administrative positions designated for the Indian Administrative Service cadre.

title: Rawalpindi Braces For Mega Protest By Imran Khan Supporters, Gatherings Banned
content: Amid continued rumours about the death of former Pakistan PM Imran Khan and fears of unrest, the government has imposed Section 144 in Rawalpindi, banning public gatherings. The move comes amid planned protests by Khan's PTI demanding access to him.

title: Chennai Metro Train Stuck In Subway, Commuters Forced To Walk Through Tunnel
content: The train got stuck in a subway between the Central Metro and High Court station. Passengers on board complained of no electricity.

title: Activist Rahul Easwar Gets 14-Day Judicial Custody In Kerala MLA Rape Case
content: A court on Monday dismissed the bail petition of activist Rahul Easwar and remanded him to judicial custody for allegedly defaming the complainant in the sexual assault case against MLA Rahul Mamkoottathil.

title: Hyderabad Metro Gets 20 Transgender Security Personnel
content: Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited (HMRL) has announced the induction of 20 transgender personnel into its frontline security services, in what is seen as a major step toward social empowerment and enhanced commuter security.

title: Venezuelan Parliament Suspends Session On US Attacks Investigation
content: Venezuela's National Assembly on Monday suspended an extraordinary session to debate forming a commission to investigate deadly attacks ordered by the US administration against vessels suspected of drug trafficking off Venezuela's coast.

title: "Baseless": India Rejects Pak's Airspace Denial Claims For Sri Lanka Aid
content: India has granted rapid clearance for Pakistan's aid flight carrying relief material to cyclone-hit Sri Lanka, firmly rejecting "baseless and misleading" claims circulating in Pakistani media that New Delhi had denied permission to use its airspace.

title: Apple Names Amar Subramanya As New Vice President Of AI
content: Apple on Monday named veteran researcher Amar Subramanya as its vice president of AI, replacing John Giannandrea.

title: Delhi India Gate Protest: 3 Protestors Sent To Police Custody
content: A Delhi court on Monday remanded three protesters to three days of police custody in a case relating to the alleged use of pepper spray on police personnel during a demonstration at the India Gate over pollution last month.

title: Don't Want "A Slave's Peace": Venezuela's Maduro On US Military Threat
content: Venezuela does not want "a slave's peace," President Nicolas Maduro told thousands of supporters Monday about a US military deployment he said has been "testing" his country for months.

title: Amid US-Backed Peace Talks, Russia Claims Capture Of Ukraine's Pokrovsk
content: Russia said Monday its forces had captured the city of Pokrovsk in eastern Ukraine, a key military logistics hub, as well as the city of Vovchansk in the northeast.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Schools, Colleges To Remain Shut Today In Chennai, Other Districts
content: Schools and colleges across Chennai, Tiruvallur and Kanchipuram districts will remain closed today following forecasts of heavy rain triggered by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: US Court Disqualifies Ex-Trump Lawyer Alina Habba As New Jersey Prosecutor
content: A US appeals court on Monday struck down an attempt by President Donald Trump to bypass the customary Senate confirmation process and appoint his former personal lawyer to a post as a top federal prosecutor.

title: Son Of 'El Chapo' Pleads Guilty In US Drug Trafficking Prosecution
content: A son of notorious Mexican drug kingpin "El Chapo" pleaded guilty Monday to US drug trafficking charges, months after his brother entered a plea deal.

title: US Sees "Optimistic" Chance Of Ukraine Deal As Envoy Witkoff Heads To Moscow
content: The White House said Monday it was "very optimistic" of a deal being reached to end the Russia-Ukraine war, as US envoy Steve Witkoff heads to Moscow for talks with President Vladimir Putin.

title: "Excellent Health": White House Releases Trump's MRI Report
content: US President Donald Trump was shown to have "excellent" cardiovascular health by an MRI scan performed during a surprise October hospital visit that fueled speculation about his physical condition, his doctor said Monday.

title: "Open Challenge": Trinamool MP To Administration Over Babri Masjid Plan
content: Trinamool Congress MLA Humayun Kabir, who sparked a major controversy with his plans to build a Babri Masjid replica in Bengal's Murshidabad district, has now warned the administration against interfering with his plan

title: Record 24,000 Runners Participate In 9th Adani Ahmedabad Marathon
content: The city of Ahmedabad transformed into a vibrant celebration of endurance and unity as more than 24,000 runners took part in the 9th Adani Ahmedabad Marathon at the Sabarmati Riverfront Sports Park.

title: 'Will Be Good If India Designates Hamas Terror Group,' Says Israeli Army
content: Israeli Defence Forces on Monday said it would be good if India recognises Hamas as a terrorist group.

title: IITs bar from placement drive 20+ companies that rescinded offers
content: Over 20 companies have been banned from participating in the IIT placement season for revoking job offers made to students, some as late as June or July. This decision was made unanimously by IITs to protect students' career prospects and mental well-being. The banned firms can still recruit through off-campus processes.

title: Govt orders handset makers to preload its Sanchar Saathi app
content: Smartphone manufacturers must now pre-install the government's Sanchar Saathi app on all devices sold in India. This mandate, effective within 90 days, aims to bolster cyber security and prevent IMEI tampering. However, privacy advocates express strong concerns, viewing it as an invasion of personal space and a potential threat to user data.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Chennai, suburbs wake to season’s wettest morning; schools, colleges closed
content: Cyclone Ditwah, after weakening, surprised Chennai with a deluge on Monday morning, causing widespread flooding and traffic disruptions. The India Meteorological Department issued orange and red alerts for the city and Tiruvallur respectively. Weathermen predict continued heavy rain for the region as the system lingers offshore.

title: ‘Don’t want a slave’s peace’: Maduro hits back at Trump's 'leave Venezuela' threat; tensions escalate
content: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro rejected a "slave's peace" amid escalating US pressure, accusing Washington of testing the nation with a prolonged naval deployment.  Reports suggest President Trump issued an ultimatum for Maduro to step down, which was reportedly refused. The US has intensified military pressure in the Caribbean, with strikes targeting suspected drug-carrying boats.

title: Sunjay Kapur property row: Not mentioned in will, mother Rani Kapur joins forces with Karisma Kapoor
content: A bitter inheritance battle has erupted over industrialist Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000-crore estate. His mother, Rani Kapur, has joined forces with his ex-wife Karisma Kapoor, challenging the validity of his will. They allege Sunjay's wife, Priya, is attempting to seize assets and question the will's authenticity, claiming it omits key family members and assets.

title: Internet outages fallout: Google and Amazon join hands; here’s what it means
content: Amazon Web Services and Google Cloud have launched a joint multicloud networking service to enhance internet reliability and speed up connections between platforms. This collaboration aims to reduce costly service disruptions, with early adopters like Salesforce already utilizing the new interoperable approach. The move highlights a growing need for seamless connectivity even among major cloud competitors.

title: 'We are ready': BSF warns of 120 terrorists on LoC launch pads; cautious with Op Sindoor phase 2
content: BSF Kashmir IG Ashok Yadav stated that "120 terrorists" on 69 launch pads across the LoC are under close watch, with Operation Sindoor ready for activation if Pakistan attempts any "misadventure." Following Indian strikes, Pakistan shifted some launch pads deeper, but they remain under surveillance. Infiltration attempts have significantly dropped this year.

title: IND vs SA: Arshdeep reveals what Rohit said during his animated reaction after Kohli's ton - Watch
content: Virat Kohli's magnificent 52nd ODI century, a blistering 135, powered India to 349 against South Africa. A crucial partnership with Rohit Sharma underscored their enduring class.  While Kohli celebrated his 83rd international ton, Arshdeep Singh humorously revealed Rohit's quirky reaction.  Discussions about their 2027 World Cup future are ongoing, with potential domestic tournaments and BCCI meetings planned.

title: Smriti Mandhana wedding postponed: Has Palash Muchhal also deleted Instagram posts?
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana and composer Palash Muchhal's November 23 wedding has been postponed due to unexpected family health emergencies. Mandhana's father and groom-to-be Muchhal were hospitalized, leading to the decision. Both are now recovering, but a new date is yet to be announced. Friend Jemimah Rodrigues has withdrawn from WBBL to support Mandhana.

title: 'We are in deep trouble': How US is lagging behind China - Ford CEO explains
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley warns of a critical US trade worker shortage, leaving 1 million jobs unfilled. He highlights a dangerous gap compared to China in building essential workforces, impacting national security. Farley advocates for rebuilding the blue-collar pipeline through education and cultural respect, citing Ford's recent union agreements as a step towards career stability for workers.

title: SC orders CBI probe into ‘digital arrest’ scam cases
content: The Supreme Court has ordered a pan-India CBI probe into digital arrest scams, granting the agency a free hand to investigate bankers involved in mule accounts. The court also directed coordination with Interpol and asked the RBI to explore AI for identifying suspicious bank accounts, while emphasizing the need for better SIM card issuance norms and state-level cybercrime coordination centers.

title: Rate rejig: GST collection growth moderates in November
content: November GST collections saw modest growth after a significant rate overhaul, with the government highlighting increased consumption as a positive sign. While domestic revenue dipped slightly, import collections rose, and net collections improved due to lower refunds. Officials expressed optimism that these trends indicate a sustainable reform with a future multiplier effect.

title: From Apple to Microsoft: Bill Gates billion-dollar bet; How Gates bought Halo game maker
content: Microsoft acquired Bungie Studios in 2000 after Halo's debut at Macworld with Steve Jobs. This strategic move transformed the game from a potential Mac exclusive into Xbox's flagship franchise. The acquisition, occurring when Bungie faced financial struggles, proved pivotal, launching Halo: Combat Evolved alongside the Xbox and establishing Microsoft's gaming dominance.

title: 'Mainu apne naal leja': Bizman dies trying to save family in Ludhiana; three security guards arrested
content: A 32-year-old businessman tragically died shielding his family during a wedding shootout in Ludhiana, where around 30 rounds were fired. The incident, described as a fight for supremacy between local criminals, resulted in two deaths, including the groom's aunt. Prime accused Shubham Arora remains at large, while Ankur has been arrested.

title: Winter session: SIR debate demand wipes out Day 1; Rijiju rebuffs Opposition
content: Parliamentary proceedings were disrupted on the first day of the winter session as opposition parties demanded an immediate debate on the Election Commission's special intensive revision of electoral rolls. The government refused to commit to a timeline, leading to walkouts and adjournments. The opposition remains determined to force the issue, despite internal disagreements.

title: Why Giants rookie Jaxson Dart wears eye black and his signature chain ritual
content: New York Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart's sparkling necklace is more than just an accessory; it's a cherished gift from his sister. This meaningful charm, worn for every game, symbolizes family, faith, and a reminder to spread love and joy. Dart views it as a powerful connection to home, grounding him amidst the NFL's spotlight.

title: ‘I couldn’t take it’: Jemimah reveals why she deleted WhatsApp post-World Cup; cites privacy
content: Indian cricketer Jemimah Rodrigues deactivated WhatsApp after receiving a thousand messages post her semi-final heroics in the Women's World Cup.  Overwhelmed by the attention while preparing for the final, she disconnected from digital platforms to maintain focus. This highlights the immense public interest in women's cricket and the challenges athletes face managing newfound fame.

title: Cardi B and Stefon Diggs look in love while celebrating his birthday on Instagram
content: Cardi B delighted fans by sharing glimpses of Stefon Diggs' birthday. A custom Snoopy football cake, celebrating his jersey number, stole the show. Later, a video captured the couple joyfully rapping and dancing in a car, radiating pure, unadulterated fun. This intimate peek into their celebration resonated deeply, earning them 'relationship goals' praise.

title: Leon Draisaitl’s sharp message puts fresh spotlight on Connor McDavid’s leadership
content: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.

title: ‘Tere Ishk Mein’ box office: Dhanush-Kriti film sees 50% drop on first Monday
content: 'Tere Ishk Mein' is performing impressively at the box office, maintaining strong collections despite a weekend dip. The romantic drama starring Dhanush and Kriti Sanon has garnered significant audience appreciation, evident in its steady footfalls across major cities and positive word-of-mouth. The film's success marks a new milestone for Dhanush, becoming his highest-earning Hindi venture.

title: ‘Arbitrary and unfair’: Fadnavis slams SEC for postponing civic polls; calls it ‘legally wrong’
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis strongly condemned the State Election Commission's abrupt postponement of municipal council elections, deeming it arbitrary and legally flawed. He argued that such decisions unfairly impact candidates and set a dangerous precedent for election delays. The government will formally request the commission to reconsider its decision, citing significant injustice to voters and candidates.

title: SIR: UP headmaster dies of heart attack; toll rises to 8 in 10 days
content: Eight election workers have died in Uttar Pradesh during intensive revision duties in just ten days, including three suicides. A headmaster in Sambhal succumbed to a heart attack, with his family citing immense work pressure. Officials are facing scrutiny as teachers, often deployed due to manpower shortages, bear the brunt of demanding electoral tasks.

title: Oncologist reveals 4 surprising signs of cancer that most miss
content: Cancer can bring unexpected health challenges. Experts highlight four often-overlooked signs. These include pain after drinking alcohol, bone fractures from minor incidents, unusually high calcium levels, and changes in breast tissue or nipple discharge. Early detection through awareness of these symptoms is crucial for better outcomes. Consulting a doctor is advised if these signs appear. Read below to know more!

title: Can give life convict bail during pendency of appeal if he has a fair chance of acquittal: SC
content: The Supreme Court has adopted a more lenient stance on bail for life convicts, stating that release is possible during appeal if acquittal appears likely. Applying this, a Tamil Nadu police officer convicted in a custodial death case was granted bail.

title: Third case this year: KIIT student dead in hostel; complaint alleges harassment
content: An 18-year-old student was discovered deceased in his hostel room in KIIT, prompting police to suspect suicide. This incident is the third of its kind this year. The grieving mother has pointed fingers at a girl from Chhattisgarh and her family for alleged harassment, which she believes contributed to her son taking the step.

title: Bill Belichick’s romantic moment with Jordon Hudson after UNC loss steals spotlight
content: Following a crushing UNC loss, Bill Belichick's gesture of giving his coat to girlfriend Jordon Hudson sparked a social media storm. While some saw a sweet, gentlemanly act, others criticized the timing and optics, especially given the team's performance and their relationship's public scrutiny. This small moment overshadowed the game's outcome, highlighting the intense focus on Belichick and Hudson.

title: Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion break the internet with new relationships
content: Rappers Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion are reportedly dating athletes Stefon Diggs and Klay Thompson. Fans are celebrating these pairings online. Cardi B is expecting a child with Stefon Diggs. Their relationships are seen as a positive development for the music stars. The public is embracing this crossover of hip-hop and sports.

title: 35 years on, CBI arrests Yasin aide wanted for Rubaiya abduction
content: A suspect, wanted for 35 years in the 1989 abduction of Rubaiya Sayeed, has been arrested by the CBI. Shafat Ahmed Shangloo, with a Rs 10 lakh bounty, allegedly conspired with jailed JKLF chief Yasin Malik. Rubaiya Sayeed identified Malik as one of her captors in court.

title: Parliament winter session: On CPR’s 1st day as RS chairman, Congress raises Dhankhar issue
content: Vice President C.P. Radhakrishnan's first day as Rajya Sabha chairman saw a warm welcome from the treasury benches, led by PM Modi, praising his democratic rise. However, the opposition, led by Mallikarjun Kharge, clashed with the treasury, raising concerns about the previous chairman's sudden exit and demanding equal treatment for opposition voices.

title: Texas beheading case: Man who killed Indian-origin motel owner won’t face death; life term likely
content: The chilling case of a beheading of an Indian-origin man in Texas, which initially sparked presidential interest, has evolved dramatically. Yordanis Cobos-Martinez, the  accused, an undocumented immigrant from Cuba with a checkered past, will bypass death row and instead serve life in prison without the chance of parole.

title: Winter may be chillier with more cold waves in parts of north: IMD
content: Central and parts of northwest and peninsular India brace for a colder winter with below-normal day and night temperatures expected from December to February. The region anticipates an increase of 4-5 additional cold wave days, potentially impacting vulnerable populations and transportation. Authorities are advised to maintain preparedness for these weather shifts.

title: Stefon Diggs injury update: Patriots WR expected to play vs Giants tonight
content: The New England Patriots are on a winning streak, with star wide receiver Stefon Diggs expected to play against the New York Giants tonight despite recent personal controversies. While Diggs faces lawsuits and drama involving Cardi B, his focus remains on the field. The team, currently strong, hopes for a successful season, with the game airing on ESPN.

title: Winter session: MP makes a statement with a stray, sets off a dogfight
content: Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury brought a rescued stray dog to Parliament, stating "Those sitting inside Parliament bite, dogs don't." She claimed the government dislikes animals. Union minister Ramdas Athawale retorted, "You keep bringing 'kutta' here and we will continue to get 'satta'." BJP MP Jagdambika Pal accused Chowdhury of "tamasha" and violating protocol.

title: Bioterror serious concern, all nations must be ready: EAM Jaishankar
content: India's Foreign Minister S Jaishankar emphasized the urgent need for international cooperation to combat bioterrorism, warning that the misuse of biological weapons by non-State actors is a growing threat.

title: ED notice to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, chief principal secretary KM Abraham
content: The ED has issued show-cause notices to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, his chief principal secretary, and former finance minister in a Rs 467 crore FEMA violation case. The notices relate to KIIFB's alleged misuse of funds raised through masala bonds for land purchase, which is prohibited under RBI directives.

title: S-400s, oil & RuPay-Mir: Modi–Putin summit tests India's tightrope between Russia, the West
content: As Russian President Vladimir Putin visits New Delhi, it will be his first visit to India since the Ukraine war began. As the two old partners Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Putin meet again, the news will be about missiles and credit cards, fighter jets, and oil flows. But the real story behind may be far more complicated.

title: Where is Imran Khan? Son says 'something irreversible' is being hidden; officials claim ex-PM 'safe'
content: Imran Khan's son, Kasim Khan, expressed grave concerns to Reuters, fearing "something irreversible" is happening to his father due to a lack of verifiable contact and denied access to his personal physician.  Despite jail authorities claiming Khan is in good health, the family's fears are amplified by prolonged isolation and mounting speculation.

title: 7 red drinks that lower LDL cholesterol and boost heart health
content: Boost your heart health naturally by incorporating vibrant red drinks into your diet. Beverages like beetroot, pomegranate, and red grape juices, along with hibiscus and cranberry teas, are rich in antioxidants and flavonoids. These powerhouses help lower bad cholesterol, raise good cholesterol, and improve circulation, offering a delicious path to a healthier cardiovascular system.

title: Bank scams: Mallya, Nirav, other fugitives owe over Rs 58K cr; only 33% recovered
content: Fugitive economic offenders owe Indian public sector banks over Rs 58,082 crore, including Rs 26,645 crore principal and Rs 31,437 crore interest as of October 2025. Fifteen individuals, including Vijay Mallya and Nirav Modi, have been declared Fugitive Economic Offenders, with nine linked to major bank frauds. Banks have recovered Rs 19,187 crore so far.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo status vs Wizards: Latest injury update
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable to play against the Wizards, offering renewed optimism for the Milwaukee Bucks after a seven-game losing streak. His return, despite a left adductor strain, is crucial for the team's stability and momentum. Historically strong against Washington, his presence could significantly impact the game, even with managed minutes.

title: 'Thank you to Indian and Pakistani armed forces': Ex-Lanka cricketer Mathews
content: Sri Lanka grapples with Cyclone Ditwah's devastation, with former cricketer Angelo Mathews lauding international aid, particularly from India and Pakistan. Indian armed forces, through Operation Sagar Bandhu, are actively engaged in search, rescue, and humanitarian efforts, delivering vital relief and evacuating stranded individuals of multiple nationalities. The nation faces significant loss of life and widespread disruption.

title: Trey Benson injury update: Cardinals RB still out with Week 14 return unclear
content: Arizona Cardinals' running back Trey Benson's return from knee surgery remains uncertain as Week 14 looms. Despite a brief practice, his continued absence fuels speculation about a setback. While the team is cautious, Week 15 is now the most probable target for his activation, with a December 10th deadline approaching.

title: 'Moment of pride': EC gets global recognition; comes amid oppn's SIR attack
content: India has been invited to chair the International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance (International IDEA) for the first time, a recognition of its successful electoral process. Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar will assume the Chair on December 3, 2026, in Stockholm, Sweden. This appointment highlights India's significant experience in managing elections for its vast electorate.

title: Stephen Curry breaks silence on unseen moment with Ayesha days after controversy
content: Amidst online criticism regarding her past remarks about marriage and children, Stephen Curry shared a heartwarming golf memory with his wife, Ayesha. He recounted playing from the forward tees with her during a vacation, finding it enjoyable. This comes after Ayesha's comments on a podcast about not initially wanting marriage or kids.

content: mystery fighter interrupts main event of WarGames to help Brock Lesnar, Bron Breakker and their team win . AJ Lee pinned Becky Lynch in the women's wargames match . that's the biggest question after Saturday's Survivor Series .

title: Takeaways: A chaotic tiebreaker in the ACC, plus surprising wins
content: the 2025 regular season has come and gone, and the stages are set for conference title games this week . the chaos in the ACC continues as arguably the best team in the conference will miss the title game this season . Texas earned its biggest win of the season after taking down undefeated No. 3 Texas A&M on Friday evening .

title: Big win, better trolls: Panthers poke fun at Rams after upset
content: the Carolina Panthers beat the los Angeles Rams 31-28 at home . it marked the fourth quarter's seventh upset victory of the season . the Panthers posted a photo of a "W" shaved onto a Ram .

content: Texas A&M lost its spot in the SEC championship game and its undefeated season . the rest of the teams in position to reach the CFP all managed to win . let's break down the rankings .

title: NFL Week 14 odds: Bears underdogs at Packers, Ravens favored over Steelers
content: the Dallas Cowboys visit the Detroit Lions as underdogs on "Thursday Night Football" the cowboys have back-to-back wins over the Philadelphia Eagles and Kansas City Chiefs . the Lions are coming off a loss at home to the Green Bay Packers .

title: 'A man of the people': Caleb Williams and more of NFL Week 13's top quotes
content: this week was a good reminder that some of the game's best moments come from what's said before and after the whistle . players and coaches carried their teams' momentum from the field to the podium . the Bears had plenty to celebrate after downing the Philadelphia Eagles 24-15 .

title: Projecting Tuesday's penultimate CFP top 12
content: 11 of the committee's top 12 teams won during Rivalry Week . the résumés are complete, with exception of teams that will play for their respective conference championship games . a fifth and penultimate ranking Tuesday night will be the best indicator all season .

title: Lane Kiffin, Thanksgiving and CFB conference champs: A busy weekend at sportsbooks
content: oddsmakers think Lane Kiffin's departure from Ole Miss triggered a guessing game at sportsbooks . the mercurial coach will not be heading into the college football playoff . oddsmakers say he's worth upwards of four points .

title: Who is NBA Cup MVP? Can anyone stop OKC? Big questions ahead of the quarters
content: the Emirates NBA Cup wrapped its group stage Friday to set up four matchups, each with a trip to Las Vegas at stake . the group stage is set to begin on tuesday . a panel of insiders is breaking down another year of thrilling group stage play and previewing the quarters .

title: Where Kentucky ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . the ouster of James Franklin sent a message around the sport: Almost no coach is safe . there are now nine schools looking for head coaches: UCLA, Cal, and now Michigan State .

title: 🏈 CFB Power Rankings: Texas Tech into top five
content: coach's prolonged employment decision didn't really qualify as surprising for those who have followed his career . Trinidad Chambliss was one of the season's most delightful surprises . he finished the regular season with 3,016 passing yards and 18 touchdowns .

title: Takeaways: Top AFC seed for Broncos? Panthers are legit?
content: the Bears extended their win streak to five games with a decisive win over the Eagles on black Friday . the 49ers trimmed the Rams' NFC West lead by a dominant victory over the Browns . Tampa Bay broke its three-game losing streak, the Dolphins won their third straight .

title: Asia's arms race shift: India climbs, China slides amid PLA graft charges
content: global arms revenues surged to an all-time high of $679 billion in 2024, up 5.9% in real terms . Asia and Oceania stood out as the only region to post a decline . China's arms revenues fell 10%, a setback tied to a wave of corruption scandals and major contract delays .

title: 'Highly exaggerated': EC files affidavit in SC defending SIR; calls allegations politically motivated
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics.
